Papers

Some papers (essentially longer blog posts) I’ve written either for school or to explore some problem of interest:

  • Azuma-Hoeffding Inequality - Exploring how Martingales and their concentration bounds can be applied to combinatorics and counting problems.

  • BigDL - Benchmarking Intel’s CPU-based DL library vs. GPU-accelerated TensorFlow.

  • Machine Learning and Cancer - Non-technical discussion of potential future applications of ML to cancer research.
